intro: Milla laxa, commonly known as the slender milla, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pendulous flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Milla laxa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
